children.name: HP recognizes that privacy is a fundamental human right and further recognizes the importance of privacy, security and data protection to our customers and partners worldwide. As a global organization, with legal entities, business processes, management structures, and technical systems that cross international borders, we strive to provide protections across all of our operations that exceed legal minimums and to deploy consistent, rigorous policies and procedures. This Privacy Statement informs you of our privacy practices and of the choices you can make and rights you can exercise in relation to your personal data, including information that may be collected from use of devices.

This Privacy Policy (“Policy”) describes the policies and procedures on the collection, use and disclosure of your information when you use our HP TechPulse mobile application made available by HP Inc (“HP Inc.”, “Company”, “we”, “us” and “our”). The terms “you” and “your” refer to the user of the TechPulse Application. The term “Services” refers to any services offered by TechPulse platform.
This Privacy Policy should be read in conjunction and together with the HP Inc. privacy policy available at

The Company respects your privacy and values the trust you place in it. Set out below is the Company’s ‘Privacy Policy’ which details the way information relating to you is collected, used, and disclosed.

HP TechPulse is a telemetry and analytics application that provides critical data around devices and applications, putting deep learning at IT's fingertips so they provide employees with the right device, software, and services to succeed. HP TechPulse proactively identifies issues, enables remedies at scale, and minimizes threats by actively monitoring the security posture of the organization.

By using the TechPulse Platform and the Services, you agree and consent to the collection, transfer, use, storage, disclosure and sharing of your information as described and collected by us in accordance with this Policy.

If we modify our Privacy Statement, we will post the revised statement here, with an updated revision date. If we make significant changes to our Privacy Statement that materially alter our privacy practices, we may also notify you by other means, such as sending an email or posting a notice on our corporate website and/or social media pages prior to the changes taking effect.
• Data You Give Us We do not collect any user personal data. User enroll the device using the customer provided PIN and no user personal details are collected or processed.
We do not collect any user personal data. User enroll the device using the customer provided PIN and no user personal details are collected or processed.

• Data We Collect The information we collect is necessary for our business function and activities. To provide TechPulse products, we must process information about the device. This application is primarily intended for corporate owned Android devices. By signing up for our service and accepting our terms and conditions customers have indicated that they want us to collect analytics on their devices, including Location Information. We automatically collect the below set of device information periodically. ◦ Location information. We collect device location information periodically even when the application is in background. Location is collected only when the customer enables the location tracking and end user provides the consent through OS permissions dialog. ◦ Battery Information. We collect data about device battery information. This data includes battery health, capacity, and temperature. ◦ Memory Information. We collect device memory information. This data includes device total memory and free memory. ◦ Storage Information. We collect device details about storage units on the device. We capture storage capacity, available free space, and type of storage unit such as internal vs external. ◦ Device/System information. We collect device-specific information. This includes information such as device operating system, device serial number, device name, processor details, processor architecture, OS version and CPU vendor. ◦ Network Usage Statistics. We collect details about how network is used over a period. This data includes network carrier details, amount of data received and transmitted over a period. ◦ App Usage Statistics. We collect application usage data from the device. This data includes amount of time a particular application is in foreground over a period and amount of storage space consumed by the app. ◦ Installed Applications. We collect data about installed applications on the device. This includes system apps and user apps.

The information we collect is necessary for our business function and activities. To provide TechPulse products, we must process information about the device. This application is primarily intended for corporate owned Android devices. By signing up for our service and accepting our terms and conditions customers have indicated that they want us to collect analytics on their devices, including Location Information.
We automatically collect the below set of device information periodically.

◦ Location information. We collect device location information periodically even when the application is in background. Location is collected only when the customer enables the location tracking and end user provides the consent through OS permissions dialog.

We collect device location information periodically even when the application is in background. Location is collected only when the customer enables the location tracking and end user provides the consent through OS permissions dialog.
◦ Battery Information. We collect data about device battery information. This data includes battery health, capacity, and temperature.
We collect data about device battery information. This data includes battery health, capacity, and temperature.
◦ Memory Information. We collect device memory information. This data includes device total memory and free memory.
We collect device memory information. This data includes device total memory and free memory.
◦ Storage Information. We collect device details about storage units on the device. We capture storage capacity, available free space, and type of storage unit such as internal vs external.
We collect device details about storage units on the device. We capture storage capacity, available free space, and type of storage unit such as internal vs external.

◦ Device/System information. We collect device-specific information. This includes information such as device operating system, device serial number, device name, processor details, processor architecture, OS version and CPU vendor.

We collect device-specific information. This includes information such as device operating system, device serial number, device name, processor details, processor architecture, OS version and CPU vendor.
◦ Network Usage Statistics. We collect details about how network is used over a period. This data includes network carrier details, amount of data received and transmitted over a period.
We collect details about how network is used over a period. This data includes network carrier details, amount of data received and transmitted over a period.

◦ App Usage Statistics. We collect application usage data from the device. This data includes amount of time a particular application is in foreground over a period and amount of storage space consumed by the app.
We collect application usage data from the device. This data includes amount of time a particular application is in foreground over a period and amount of storage space consumed by the app.
◦ Installed Applications. We collect data about installed applications on the device. This includes system apps and user apps.
We collect data about installed applications on the device. This includes system apps and user apps.
We use the information we collect for following purposes, including:

• Location information. HP TechPulse is a device analytics platform that customers purchase to track and view key metrics about their fleet of devices by location. Access to the user’s location in the Android OS is essential to our customers’ ability to group and manage the devices by their location in HP TechPulse. Primarily, location is used to protect the lost device.

HP TechPulse is a device analytics platform that customers purchase to track and view key metrics about their fleet of devices by location. Access to the user’s location in the Android OS is essential to our customers’ ability to group and manage the devices by their location in HP TechPulse. Primarily, location is used to
• Battery. To provide information on battery replacement recommendation based on battery health of devices enrolled in Proactive Management.
To provide information on battery replacement recommendation based on battery health of devices enrolled in Proactive Management.
• Device Utilization. To provide information about devices that have high storage and memory utilization, and the software applications causing high CPU and memory utilization.
To provide information about devices that have high storage and memory utilization, and the software applications causing high CPU and memory utilization.
• Storage Capacity. To forecast ahead the time duration left prior to the disk space reaching a predetermined threshold
To forecast ahead the time duration left prior to the disk space reaching a predetermined threshold

• Hardware Health. To show a monthly trend of suboptimal devices as unhealthy and facilitates drilling down to identify devices failing to meet individual performance metrics (i.e. battery health, disk health, thermal health, network, applications, memory, and storage space utilization).

To show a monthly trend of suboptimal devices as unhealthy and facilitates drilling down to identify devices failing to meet individual performance metrics (i.e. battery health, disk health, thermal health, network, applications, memory, and storage space utilization).

• Mobility Factor. To provide information on the mobility aspects of devices by classifying devices into various mobility factor categories and grouping device mobility factor by hardware health. Unhealthy devices with highest mobility factor may require attention by IT as opposed to unhealthy devices with low mobility factor.

To provide information on the mobility aspects of devices by classifying devices into various mobility factor categories and grouping device mobility factor by hardware health. Unhealthy devices with highest mobility factor may require attention by IT as opposed to unhealthy devices with low mobility factor.
• Non-Reporting Devices. To provide the hardware inventory of devices by last seen status in Proactive Management.
To provide the hardware inventory of devices by last seen status in Proactive Management.

• Software Inventory. To enable the IT administrator to view the operating system version and applications installed on devices, including the following: ◦ When an application was last updated. ◦ The top applications installed within the fleet. ◦ Applications updated/installed within this week, last week, or last month.
To enable the IT administrator to view the operating system version and applications installed on devices, including the following:
◦ When an application was last updated.
When an application was last updated.
◦ The top applications installed within the fleet.
The top applications installed within the fleet.
◦ Applications updated/installed within this week, last week, or last month.
Applications updated/installed within this week, last week, or last month.
• Software Utilization. Provides information on the top twenty-five software applications that are most used across all devices.
Provides information on the top twenty-five software applications that are most used across all devices.
We will only share your personal data as follows and, when applicable, only with the appropriate contractual obligations in place:

• Sharing with HP Companies We may transfer your personal data to other HP entities in the US and worldwide for the purposes outlined in this Privacy Statement. To ensure that your personal data is secure and as part of our participation in the  APEC Cross Border Privacy Rules, Binding Corporate Rules  and Privacy Shield  programs, HP entities are contractually bound to comply with our privacy requirements. Furthermore, our privacy guidelines are communicated to our HP employees on an annual basis as part of our mandatory trainings. Where the international privacy programs identified above do not apply, when you agree to accept HP’s Privacy Statement when registering a product or for service, creating an account, or otherwise providing us with your personal data, you consent to the transfer of your personal data throughout the global HP network of entities.

We may transfer your personal data to other HP entities in the US and worldwide for the purposes outlined in this Privacy Statement. To ensure that your personal data is secure and as part of our participation in the

programs, HP entities are contractually bound to comply with our privacy requirements. Furthermore, our privacy guidelines are communicated to our HP employees on an annual basis as part of our mandatory trainings.

Where the international privacy programs identified above do not apply, when you agree to accept HP’s Privacy Statement when registering a product or for service, creating an account, or otherwise providing us with your personal data, you consent to the transfer of your personal data throughout the global HP network of entities.

• Sharing with Service Providers and Partners We engage service providers or partners to manage or support certain aspects of our business operations on our behalf. These service providers or partners may be located in the US or in other global locations and may provide services such as credit card processing and fraud management services, customer support, sales pursuits on our behalf, order fulfilment, product delivery, content personalization, advertising and marketing activities (including digital and personalized advertising), IT services, email service providers, data hosting, live-help, debt collection and management, customer satisfaction surveys or support of HP websites. Our service providers and partners are required by contract to safeguard any personal data they receive from us and are prohibited from using the personal data for any purpose other than to perform the services as instructed by HP. In some cases, HP might contact you to measure your satisfaction with the delivery of our products and services provided by those service providers and partners.
Sharing with Service Providers and Partners
Sharing with Service Providers and Partners

We engage service providers or partners to manage or support certain aspects of our business operations on our behalf. These service providers or partners may be located in the US or in other global locations and may provide services such as credit card processing and fraud management services, customer support, sales pursuits on our behalf, order fulfilment, product delivery, content personalization, advertising and marketing activities (including digital and personalized advertising), IT services, email service providers, data hosting, live-help, debt collection and management, customer satisfaction surveys or support of HP websites. Our service providers and partners are required by contract to safeguard any personal data they receive from us and are prohibited from using the personal data for any purpose other than to perform the services as instructed by HP. In some cases, HP might contact you to measure your satisfaction with the delivery of our products and services provided by those service providers and partners.
How We Retain and Keep Your Data Secure
How We Retain and Keep Your Data Secure

To prevent loss, unauthorized access, use or disclosure and to ensure the appropriate use of your information, we utilize reasonable and appropriate physical, technical, and administrative procedures to safeguard the information we collect and process. HP retains data as required or permitted by law and while the data continues to have a legitimate business purpose.

When collecting, transferring, or storing sensitive information we use a variety of additional security technologies and procedures to help protect your personal data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure.

We keep your personal data for as long as necessary to provide you with HP Services, for legitimate and essential business purposes, such as making data-driven business decisions, complying with our legal obligations, and resolving disputes. HP is committed to protecting the privacy of all personal data processed and aims to ensure that personal data is not kept for longer than is necessary for the purpose for which it was collected, held, and processed. The retention periods for HP held personal data varies depending on whether that data is held as part of a legally required business record.
To exercise your rights, or if you have any questions or concerns about our Privacy Statement, our collection and use of your data or a possible breach of local privacy laws, you can contact
HP’s Chief Privacy and Data Protection Officer
HP’s Chief Privacy and Data Protection Officer
or write to us at the appropriate address below:

We use cookies (or similar technologies) to personalize content and ads, to provide social media features and to analyse our traffic. By clicking "Accept ", you agree to this and the sharing of information
about your use of our site with our affiliates & partners. You can manage your preferences in Cookie Settings, withdraw your consent at any time or find out more about

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.
More information about your privacy, opens in a new tab
Please visit our Use of Cookies and other Technologies Notice for more information.

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages.If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites.If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.
